name: Response
headline: Control indirect spend from end-to-end.
description: At Response, we simplify how ops teams manage indirect spend—everything from office supplies to maintenance materials and packaging. Our platform streamlines procurement, cutting ordering and approval times by up to 92% and helping companies save up to 13% by centralizing purchases with their existing vendors.

founders.name: Keivan Shahida, Founder
founders.description: Endurance athlete (marathons, murphs, etc.) and co-founder & CEO @ Response.

founders.name: Kais Baillargeon, Founder
founders.description: Kais is a co-founder at Response. He was raised in London and studied OR at Cornell. Before Response, he worked in operations in the Middle East - from logistics at Aramex to industrial gases at Gulf Cryo. He loves piano, tennis, and visiting art museums in his spare time.

generated_description:
### Response: Revolutionizing Indirect Spend Management

**Overview**
Founded in 2019 and located in the bustling heart of San Francisco, Response is a startup born out of the Y Combinator Batch S20. With a lean team of eight, they’re tackling the complex world of indirect spending, helping businesses streamline their procurement processes.

**Mission**
At its core, Response aims to control indirect spend from end to end. They simplify how operations teams manage purchases—think office supplies, maintenance materials, and packaging—making it easier for companies to save both time and money. 

**How They Do It**
Response's platform dramatically reduces ordering and approval times by up to 92%, while also assisting organizations in saving as much as 13% through centralized purchasing with existing vendors. Their features include:

- **Personalized Storefront:** Customize what each department can buy, ensuring that every purchase aligns with budget constraints and operational needs.
- **Unified Dashboard:** A comprehensive view of all procurement activities, tracking orders, approval statuses, and analytics, which significantly cuts down on the chaos that often comes with procurement.
- **Agile Approvals:** Set up automated approval processes to minimize unauthorized spending, providing peace of mind for finance teams.
- **Powerful Analytics:** Access spending data down to the SKU level instantly, allowing for smarter purchasing decisions.

**Recent Developments**
In a remarkable show of confidence from investors, Response recently raised $4 million in a seed round. This funding will help them further develop their platform and expand their feature set, ensuring they continue to be a game-changer in the B2B marketplace for supply chain management.

**Client Endorsements**
The response from their clients speaks volumes—users like David Oster from Playaway highlight the drastic reduction in ordering times and enhanced budgeting capabilities, while Preston Pyle from Aterian notes that Response has set a new standard for procurement.

**Future Vision**
As Response gears up for the future, they aim to integrate more features like HRIS connectivity and historical pricing benchmarks, ensuring they remain at the forefront of procurement technology.

For those eager to gain more control over indirect spend and drive significant savings without unnecessary complexity, Response is worth checking out. You can learn more about their offerings and how they can optimize your procurement processes by visiting their website: [tryresponse.com](https://www.tryresponse.com/). 

In a world where every dollar counts, Response is the beacon guiding businesses towards smarter spending.
